refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Stable, unless otherwise indicated

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The STUN Binding usage allows for easily creating and parsing STUN Binding requests and responses. It offers both an asynchronous and a synchronous API that uses the STUN timer usage.

refsect2.title: enum StunUsageBindReturn
refsect2.para: Return value of stun_usage_bind_process() and stun_usage_bind_run() which allows you to see what status the function call returned.

listitem.simpara: The binding usage succeeded
There was an unknown error in the bind usage
The message is invalid and should be ignored
The binding request has an ALTERNATE-SERVER attribute
The binding was unsuccessful because it has timed out.

refsect2.para: Create a new STUN binding request to use with a STUN server.

listitem.simpara: The StunAgent to use to create the binding request
The StunMessage to build

refsect2.title: stun_usage_bind_process ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunUsageBindReturn stun_usage_bind_process (StunMessage *msg, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen, struct sockaddr *alternate_server, socklen_t *alternate_server_len);
refsect2.para: Process a STUN binding response and extracts the mapped address from the STUN message. Also checks for the ALTERNATE-SERVER attribute.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage to process
A pointer to a sockaddr structure to fill with the mapped address that the STUN server gives us
The length of addr

A pointer to a sockaddr structure to fill with the address of an alternate server to which we should send our new STUN binding request, in case the currently used STUN server is requesting the use of an alternate server. This argument will only be filled if the return value of the function is STUN_USAGE_BIND_RETURN_ALTERNATE_SERVER
The length of alternate_server
A StunUsageBindReturn value. Note that STUN_USAGE_BIND_RETURN_TIMEOUT cannot be returned by this function

refsect2.title: stun_usage_bind_keepalive ()
refsect2.programlisting: size_t stun_usage_bind_keepalive (StunAgent *agent, StunMessage *msg, uint8_t *buf, size_t len);
refsect2.para: Creates a STUN binding indication that can be used for a keepalive. Since this is an indication message, no STUN response will be generated and it can only be used as a keepalive message.

listitem.simpara: The StunAgent to use to build the message
The StunMessage to build
The buffer to use for creating the StunMessage
The size of the buf
The length of the message to send

refsect2.title: stun_usage_bind_run ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunUsageBindReturn stun_usage_bind_run (const struct sockaddr *srv, socklen_t srvlen, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen);
refsect2.para: This is a convenience function that will do a synchronous Binding request to a server and wait for its answer. It will use the StunUsageTrans and StunUsageTimer usages to send the request and handle the response.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the sockaddr structure representing the STUN server's address
The length of srv
A pointer to a sockaddr structure to fill with the mapped address that the STUN server gives us
The length of addr
A StunUsageBindReturn. Possible return values are STUN_USAGE_BIND_RETURN_SUCCESS, STUN_USAGE_BIND_RETURN_ERROR and STUN_USAGE_BIND_RETURN_TIMEOUT
